entry.title: In Kherson, Celebration Turns to Apprehension Amid Food, Power Shortages
entry.content: In the recently retaken southern Ukrainian capital, the celebratory dancing to music on the main square has been replaced by a more humdrum physical activity: jostling for bread and water.

entry.title: 'The Hole': Gruesome Accounts of Russian Occupation Emerge From Ukrainian Nuclear Plant
entry.content: From director general on down, workers say they were kidnapped and held in underground cells, often to be beaten or tortured; ‘some people’s spirits were broken.’
